chapitre.paragraphe: The XML specification defines how to write a document in XML format.
Every custom markup language created using the XML specification must adhere to XML’s underlying grammar.
XML documents, like HTML documents, are comprised of tags and data.
Another big difference is that an XML document stores and describes that data;
It’s not uncommon to want to process a node or a set of nodes only if a certain condition is met.
The condition is written as an expression.
In the previous chapter, XSLT, you learned about creating and applying templates to transform XML documents.
When you create a template, you use a pattern to specify the nodes that the template can be applied to.
